metadata.description: Core universal concepts that form the foundation of the U-CORE ontology

concepts.name: Activity
concepts.description: Fundamental U-Core concept - processes, actions, or events

concepts.name: Adaptation
concepts.description: The process of change by which an organism or species becomes better suited to its environment.

concepts.name: Aesthetics
concepts.description: The branch of philosophy that deals with beauty, art, and taste.

concepts.name: Agent
concepts.description: Fundamental U-Core concept - entities that can act or cause change

concepts.name: Agreement
concepts.description: Fundamental U-Core concept - mutual understanding or consensus

concepts.name: Artificial Intelligence
concepts.description: Intelligence demonstrated by machines, in contrast to natural intelligence displayed by humans.

concepts.name: Amorphous
concepts.description: Solid or semi-solid state lacking long-range crystalline order; in 'water_states', includes amorphous ices and gels.

concepts.name: Anthropology
concepts.description: The study of humans, human behavior, and societies in the past and present, encompassing cultural, biological, and linguistic dimensions.

concepts.name: API
concepts.description: A contract of callable operations exposed by software modules.

concepts.name: Area
concepts.description: The extent or measurement of a surface or piece of land; the amount of space within a two-dimensional boundary.

concepts.name: Art
concepts.description: The expression or application of human creative skill and imagination, typically in a visual form.

concepts.name: Aspiration
concepts.description: A strong desire to achieve something; a hope or ambition.

concepts.name: Atoms
concepts.description: The basic units of matter, consisting of a nucleus and electrons.

concepts.name: Attention
concepts.description: The action of dealing with or taking special care of someone or something; the concentration of mental effort.

concepts.name: Biodiversity
concepts.description: The variety of life on Earth at all levels, from genes to ecosystems, including the evolutionary, ecological, and cultural processes that sustain life.

concepts.name: Biology
concepts.description: The branch of science concerned with living organisms and their vital processes.

concepts.name: Bose-Einstein
concepts.description: Quantum state of matter at near-zero temperature where particles occupy the same ground state (BEC); contextually used to denote extreme-coherence regimes.

concepts.name: Breath Loop
concepts.description: The fundamental spiral pattern of expansion and contraction found in breathing, heartbeats, and all natural cycles. Represents the basic rhythm of life and consciousness.

concepts.name: Business
concepts.description: The organized effort of individuals to produce and sell goods and services for profit, encompassing commerce, trade, and economic enterprise.

concepts.name: Causality
concepts.description: The relationship between cause and effect

concepts.name: Chemical
concepts.description: Relating to chemistry or chemicals; chemical energy is energy stored in the bonds of chemical compounds.

concepts.name: Chemistry
concepts.description: The branch of science concerned with the properties and behavior of matter.

concepts.name: Class
concepts.description: A software construct defining state and behavior; instantiable type.

concepts.name: Climate Science
concepts.description: The study of Earth's climate system, including atmospheric processes, climate change, and human impacts on global climate patterns.

concepts.name: Clustered
concepts.description: State characterized by transient molecular clusters or aggregates; in 'water_states', denotes hypothesized water clustering.

concepts.name: Colloidal
concepts.description: Dispersion state where fine particles are suspended in a medium; in 'water_states', denotes colloidal water systems.

concepts.name: Complexity
concepts.description: The state of being complex; the quality of being intricate or complicated.

concepts.name: Consciousness
concepts.description: The state of being aware and able to think and perceive

concepts.name: Consciousness Hologram
concepts.description: The idea that consciousness operates holographically, where each part of the mind contains information about the whole. Each thought reflects the entire pattern of awareness.

concepts.name: Contemplation
concepts.description: The action of looking thoughtfully at something for a long time; deep reflective thought.

concepts.name: Coordinates
concepts.description: A set of values that show an exact position on a map, graph, or other system of measurement.

concepts.name: Creating
concepts.description: The process of bringing something new into existence through imagination, skill, or effort.

concepts.name: Creator
concepts.description: One who creates or brings something new into existence.

concepts.name: Cross-View Synthesis
concepts.description: The integration of multiple perspectives, belief systems, and worldviews into a coherent whole. Each view contains partial truth that together forms a more complete picture.

concepts.name: C#
concepts.description: A modern, object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft.

concepts.name: Cultural Heritage
concepts.description: The legacy of physical artifacts and intangible attributes inherited from past generations, maintained in the present, and bestowed for future generations.

concepts.name: Culture
concepts.description: The social behavior, institutions, and norms found in human societies, including knowledge, beliefs, arts, laws, customs, and habits.

concepts.name: Determinism
concepts.description: The philosophical doctrine that all events, including human action, are ultimately determined by causes external to the will.

concepts.name: Dialectical Thinking
concepts.description: A mode of thinking that holds opposing ideas in tension and seeks synthesis. Recognizes that truth often emerges from the dynamic interaction of opposites.

concepts.name: Distance
concepts.description: The amount of space between two points; the extent of space between two objects or places.

concepts.name: Ecology
concepts.description: The branch of biology that studies the relationships between living organisms and their physical environment, including ecosystems and biodiversity.

concepts.name: Economics
concepts.description: The social science that studies how individuals, businesses, governments, and nations make choices about allocating resources.

concepts.name: Electrical
concepts.description: Relating to electricity; electrical energy is energy derived from electric potential energy or kinetic energy.

concepts.name: Emergence
concepts.description: The arising of novel properties from complex systems

concepts.name: Emotion
concepts.description: A natural instinctive state of mind deriving from one's circumstances, mood, or relationships with others.

concepts.name: Energy
concepts.description: The capacity to do work or cause change

concepts.name: Entanglement
concepts.description: Non-classical correlation between parts where joint states are inseparable; in 'quantum_dimensions', denotes entangled regimes.

concepts.name: Entity
concepts.description: Fundamental U-Core concept - anything that exists or can be conceived

concepts.name: Entrepreneurship
concepts.description: The activity of setting up and running businesses, taking on financial risks in the hope of profit and innovation.

concepts.name: Enum
concepts.description: A type consisting of a set of named constants.

concepts.name: Environmental Conservation
concepts.description: The practice of protecting and preserving natural environments, species, and resources for future generations.

concepts.name: Epistemology
concepts.description: The branch of philosophy that deals with knowledge, its nature, sources, and validity.

concepts.name: Eternity
concepts.description: Infinite or unending time; the concept of timelessness or infinite duration.

concepts.name: Ethics
concepts.description: The branch of philosophy that deals with moral principles and values.

concepts.name: Existence
concepts.description: The fundamental state of being or reality

concepts.name: Fibonacci Spiral
concepts.description: A logarithmic spiral that grows by the golden ratio, found in nature from nautilus shells to galaxy arms. Demonstrates the spiral nature of growth and evolution.

concepts.name: Field
concepts.description: A variable member of a type that stores data.

concepts.name: Fields
concepts.description: Physical quantities that have a value for each point in space and time, such as electromagnetic fields.

concepts.name: Finance
concepts.description: The management of money, banking, investments, and credit, including personal, corporate, and public finance.

concepts.name: Fractal Pattern
concepts.description: A self-similar pattern that repeats at different scales, where each part contains the structure of the whole. Fundamental to understanding complex systems and natural phenomena.

concepts.name: Framework
concepts.description: A software framework that provides a foundation for developing software applications.

concepts.name: Future
concepts.description: The time that is yet to come; events that will happen after the present moment.

concepts.name: Golden Ratio
concepts.description: A mathematical constant (φ ≈ 1.618) that appears throughout nature, art, and architecture. Represents the most aesthetically pleasing proportion and appears in spiral patterns.

concepts.name: Guardian
concepts.description: One who protects, watches over, or takes care of someone or something.

concepts.name: Hardware
concepts.description: The physical components of a computer system or other electronic device.

concepts.name: Health
concepts.description: A state of complete physical, mental, and social well-being, not merely the absence of disease or infirmity.

concepts.name: History
concepts.description: The study of past events, particularly human affairs, their causes, and their consequences on present and future.

concepts.name: Holistic Health
concepts.description: An approach to health that considers the whole person - body, mind, spirit, and emotions - in the quest for optimal wellness.

concepts.name: Holograph
concepts.description: Holographic principle view where bulk information is encoded on lower-dimensional boundaries; in 'quantum_dimensions', a projection view.

concepts.name: Holographic Principle
concepts.description: The principle that all information in a volume of space can be represented as information on the boundary of that space. Each part contains the whole.

concepts.name: HTTP Endpoint
concepts.description: A point of entry in a communication channel when two systems interact.

concepts.name: Human
concepts.description: A member of the species Homo sapiens, characterized by advanced cognitive abilities and social organization.

concepts.name: Ice
concepts.description: Solid phase of a substance characterized by an ordered crystalline lattice; in the 'water_states' axis, denotes frozen water forms.

concepts.name: Infinity
concepts.description: Unbounded growth or extent without finite limit; in 'quantum_dimensions', a formal idealization for asymptotic behaviors.

concepts.name: Information
concepts.description: Data that has meaning and can be processed or transmitted

concepts.name: Integral Theory
concepts.description: A comprehensive framework that integrates multiple perspectives and disciplines to understand reality. Combines subjective and objective, individual and collective dimensions.

concepts.name: Intent
concepts.description: Fundamental U-Core concept - purpose, goal, or aimed direction

concepts.name: Interface
concepts.description: A contract that defines a set of members without implementation.

concepts.name: JavaScript
concepts.description: A high-level, interpreted programming language that is one of the core technologies of the World Wide Web.

concepts.name: Knowledge
concepts.description: Information that has been learned, understood, and can be applied

concepts.name: Consciousness
concepts.description: Keyword for awareness and subjective experience; distinct from the fundamental concept node, this is a tagging view.

concepts.name: Dimensions
concepts.description: Keyword for degrees of freedom or coordinates needed to specify a state or position.

concepts.name: Matter
concepts.description: Free-standing keyword for physical substance (occupies space, has mass). In axis contexts, tags topics related to matter.

concepts.name: Phase
concepts.description: Keyword for phase/state parameter of a system (physical or signal/oscillatory). In axes, tags phase-related topics.

concepts.name: Physics
concepts.description: Keyword for the natural sciences that study matter, energy, space, time, and their interactions.

concepts.name: Quantum
concepts.description: Keyword for phenomena governed by quantum theory (discreteness, superposition, entanglement).

concepts.name: Reality
concepts.description: Keyword for the totality of that which exists or is experienced, independent of model or belief.

concepts.name: States
concepts.description: Keyword for distinct configurations of a system (e.g., phases of matter, modes of operation).

concepts.name: Transformation
concepts.description: Keyword for change of state, structure, or form through processes (e.g., phase change, functional transformation).

concepts.name: Water
concepts.description: Keyword for the substance H₂O across its contexts (physical, biological, symbolic). In axes, tags water-related topics.

concepts.name: Lattice Polymorphs
concepts.description: Family of crystalline forms differing in lattice arrangement (polymorphism); in 'water_states', covers multiple ice polymorphs.

concepts.name: Learner
concepts.description: One who is learning or acquiring knowledge and skills.

concepts.name: Learning
concepts.description: The process of acquiring knowledge, skills, or understanding through experience, study, or teaching.

concepts.name: Library
concepts.description: A collection of pre-written code that can be used to develop software applications.

concepts.name: Line
concepts.description: One-dimensional continuum with length but no thickness; in 'quantum_dimensions', a basic spatial degree.

concepts.name: Liquid
concepts.description: Fluid phase of a substance with fixed volume and variable shape; in the 'water_states' axis, denotes flowing water states.

concepts.name: Literature
concepts.description: Written works, especially those considered of superior or lasting artistic merit, including poetry, prose, and drama.

concepts.name: Management
concepts.description: The process of planning, organizing, leading, and controlling resources to achieve organizational goals effectively and efficiently.

concepts.name: Mandelbrot Set
concepts.description: A famous fractal set defined by a simple mathematical formula that produces infinitely complex patterns. Demonstrates how simple rules can generate infinite complexity.

concepts.name: Marketing
concepts.description: The activity of promoting and selling products or services, including market research, advertising, and understanding consumer behavior.

concepts.name: Mathematics
concepts.description: The abstract science of number, quantity, and space, either as abstract concepts or as applied to other disciplines.

concepts.name: Matter
concepts.description: Physical substance that occupies space and has mass

concepts.name: Measurement
concepts.description: Fundamental U-Core concept - quantification or assessment

concepts.name: Mechanical
concepts.description: Relating to machines or machinery; mechanical energy is the sum of potential and kinetic energy.

concepts.name: Medicine
concepts.description: The science and practice of diagnosing, treating, and preventing disease and injury in humans to maintain and restore health.

concepts.name: Meditation
concepts.description: A practice of focused attention and awareness, often used for spiritual or relaxation purposes.

concepts.name: Memory
concepts.description: The faculty by which the mind stores and remembers information.

concepts.name: Mental Health
concepts.description: The state of psychological and emotional well-being, including the diagnosis and treatment of mental disorders and promotion of mental wellness.

concepts.name: Mental Space
concepts.description: The conceptual or psychological space where thoughts, ideas, and mental processes occur.

concepts.name: Message
concepts.description: A unit of communication between systems or components.

concepts.name: Meta Identity
concepts.description: The fundamental identity concept that serves as the root of all identity relationships in the U-CORE ontology. This is the only hard-coded node that represents the core identity principle.

concepts.name: Meta Type
concepts.description: Abstract type describing categories of software constructs (class, record, enum, interface).

concepts.name: Metaphysics
concepts.description: The branch of philosophy that deals with the fundamental nature of reality and existence.

concepts.name: Method
concepts.description: A function member of a type that encapsulates behavior.

concepts.name: Mission
concepts.description: A specific task or purpose that one is assigned or chooses to undertake.

concepts.name: Module
concepts.description: A deployable logical unit of functionality within the system.

concepts.name: Molecules
concepts.description: Groups of atoms bonded together, representing the smallest fundamental units of a chemical compound.

concepts.name: Multiverse
concepts.description: Hypothesized ensemble of possible universes or branches; in 'quantum_dimensions', denotes many-worlds or modal spaces.

concepts.name: Music
concepts.description: The art of arranging sounds in time to produce composition through melody, harmony, rhythm, and timbre.

concepts.name: Mysticism
concepts.description: The belief that union with or absorption into the divine or ultimate reality may be achieved through contemplation and self-surrender.

concepts.name: Nutrition
concepts.description: The science of food, nutrients, and their relationship to health, growth, and disease prevention.

concepts.name: Objective
concepts.description: A specific, measurable goal that one aims to achieve.

concepts.name: Obligation
concepts.description: Fundamental U-Core concept - duties or responsibilities

concepts.name: Organization
concepts.description: A structured group of people with a particular purpose, such as a business or government department.

concepts.name: Paradox Resolution
concepts.description: The ability to hold seemingly contradictory truths simultaneously and find resolution at a higher level of understanding. Essential for navigating complex reality.

concepts.name: Parameter
concepts.description: A variable that is passed to a function or method to provide input data.

concepts.name: Particles
concepts.description: Small pieces of matter, including subatomic particles and larger particles.

concepts.name: Past
concepts.description: The time that has already occurred; events that have happened before the present moment.

concepts.name: Performing Arts
concepts.description: Forms of art where artists use their body, voice, or objects to convey artistic expression, including theater, dance, and music performance.

concepts.name: Phase
concepts.description: Dimension 'phase' within the 12 quantum dimensions axis.

concepts.name: Philosophy
concepts.description: The study of fundamental questions about existence, knowledge, values, and meaning

concepts.name: Physical Fitness
concepts.description: The state of health and well-being achieved through physical activity, proper nutrition, and adequate rest.

concepts.name: Physical Space
concepts.description: The three-dimensional space in which physical objects exist and move.

concepts.name: Physics
concepts.description: The branch of science concerned with the nature and properties of matter and energy.

concepts.name: Place
concepts.description: Fundamental U-Core concept - locations or spatial contexts

concepts.name: Plane
concepts.description: Two-dimensional flat manifold extending in length and width; in 'quantum_dimensions', a surface basis.

concepts.name: Plasma
concepts.description: Ionized, electrically conductive state of matter with collective electromagnetic behavior; contextualized in 'water_states' as energized states.

concepts.name: Point
concepts.description: Abstract zero-dimensional location without extent; in 'quantum_dimensions', a foundational geometric unit.

concepts.name: Politics
concepts.description: The activities associated with governance, policy-making, and the organization of society through systems of power and authority.

concepts.name: Present
concepts.description: The current moment in time; the time that is happening now.

concepts.name: Probability
concepts.description: Measure of likelihood on [0,1] governing uncertainty; in 'quantum_dimensions', reflects probabilistic amplitudes.

concepts.name: Process
concepts.description: A series of actions or steps taken to achieve a particular end.

concepts.name: Programming Language
concepts.description: A formal language comprising a set of instructions used to produce software.

concepts.name: Property
concepts.description: A member that provides controlled access to data through accessors.

concepts.name: Psychology
concepts.description: The scientific study of mind and behavior, including cognition, emotion, perception, personality, and interpersonal relationships.

concepts.name: Python
concepts.description: A high-level, interpreted programming language known for its simplicity and readability.

concepts.name: Quantum Coherent
concepts.description: Regime where quantum phases remain correlated across a system; in 'water_states', denotes proposed coherent water domains.

concepts.name: Record
concepts.description: A primarily data-centric type with value semantics.

concepts.name: Religion
concepts.description: A particular system of faith and worship, typically involving belief in a divine being or beings.

concepts.name: Resource
concepts.description: Fundamental U-Core concept - means available for use or support

concepts.name: Return Type
concepts.description: The data type that a function or method returns when it completes execution.

concepts.name: Role
concepts.description: Fundamental U-Core concept - functions or positions in contexts

concepts.name: Rule
concepts.description: Fundamental U-Core concept - principles or guidelines that govern

concepts.name: Schema
concepts.description: A structural representation of data, defining the organization and relationships of information.

concepts.name: Science
concepts.description: Systematic study of the natural world through observation and experimentation

concepts.name: Self-Organization
concepts.description: The process by which a system spontaneously organizes itself without external direction.

concepts.name: Sierpinski Triangle
concepts.description: A fractal triangle that demonstrates self-similarity through recursive subdivision. Each smaller triangle contains the same structure as the whole.

concepts.name: Social Justice
concepts.description: The concept of fair and just relations between individuals and society, including distribution of wealth, opportunities, and privileges.

concepts.name: Sociology
concepts.description: The scientific study of society, including patterns of social relationships, social interaction, and culture.

concepts.name: Software
concepts.description: Executable logical systems engineered using programming languages and tools.

concepts.name: Software System
concepts.description: A collection of software components that work together to provide functionality.

concepts.name: Space
concepts.description: The three-dimensional extent in which objects exist and events occur

concepts.name: Spiral Dynamics
concepts.description: A model of human development and cultural evolution that follows spiral patterns of increasing complexity and consciousness. Each level transcends and includes the previous.

concepts.name: Spirituality
concepts.description: The search for meaning, purpose, and connection to something greater

concepts.name: Structured
concepts.description: State exhibiting ordered micro-structure or long-range correlations; in 'water_states', denotes hypothesized structured water regimes.

concepts.name: Supercritical
concepts.description: Fluid state above critical temperature and pressure with blended liquid-gas properties; in 'water_states', denotes supercritical water.

concepts.name: System
concepts.description: A set of interconnected components that work together to achieve a common purpose.

concepts.name: Teacher
concepts.description: One who teaches or instructs others in knowledge, skills, or understanding.

concepts.name: Technology
concepts.description: Application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes

concepts.name: Thermal
concepts.description: Relating to heat or temperature; thermal energy is the internal energy of a system due to its temperature.

concepts.name: Thought
concepts.description: The process of thinking or the product of thinking; mental activity.

concepts.name: Time
concepts.description: Fundamental U-Core concept - temporal dimension and duration

concepts.name: Trade
concepts.description: The exchange of goods and services between individuals, businesses, or nations, including domestic and international commerce.

concepts.name: Transforming
concepts.description: The process of changing the form, nature, or structure of something.

concepts.name: Axis Type: codex.axis.universal
concepts.description: General type concept that classifies ontology axis nodes as universal axes; used by meta/type mappings and axis typing.

concepts.name: Understanding
concepts.description: The ability to understand something; comprehension; the ability to grasp the meaning of something.

concepts.name: Unity
concepts.description: State or principle of oneness and indivisibility; in 'quantum_dimensions', a limit of maximal coherence/symmetry.

concepts.name: Universal Mind
concepts.description: The concept that all individual minds are part of a larger, universal consciousness that contains all information holographically. Each mind reflects the whole.

concepts.name: Vapor
concepts.description: Gaseous phase of a substance below critical temperature; in the 'water_states' axis, denotes water in vapor form.

concepts.name: Virtual Space
concepts.description: A computer-simulated environment that can be experienced through digital interfaces.

concepts.name: Vision
concepts.description: A mental image of what the future could or should be like; a long-term goal or aspiration.

concepts.name: Visual Arts
concepts.description: Art forms that create works primarily visual in nature, such as painting, sculpture, photography, and graphic design.

concepts.name: Volume
concepts.description: The amount of space that a substance or object occupies, or that is enclosed within a container.

concepts.name: Wisdom
concepts.description: The quality of having experience, knowledge, and good judgment; the quality of being wise.
